<<<<<<< HEAD
A true and full relation, of the troubles in Lancashiere; between the Lord Strange, now Earle of Derby; and the well-affected people of that countie: with their valiant resistance, and full resolution. Also, certain passages between the Earl of Newcastle, and Captaine Hotham in York-sheire. Sent to a reverend divine in London. Jesland, Thomas.
8 p.
Printed for Edward Blackmoore, London : December the 9th. 1642.
Signed at end: Thomas Jesland. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======
A true and full relation, of the troubles in Lancashiere; between the Lord Strange, now Earle of Derby; and the well-affected people of that countie: with their valiant resistance, and full resolution. Also, certain passages between the Earl of Newcastle, and Captaine Hotham in York-sheire. Sent to a reverend divine in London. Jesland, Thomas.
8 p.
Printed for Edward Blackmoore, London : December the 9th. 1642.
Signed at end: Thomas Jesland. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
Edward Blackmoore
